values:
i forgot my log-in details after going by 2009 with only 2 journal entries. twitter has been my regular venting tool despite the restricted characters enabled for each tweet. it felt oddly comforting not to spill out my emo and stressful rants - but then every now and then, sometimes, i do get that urge to write, write, write (just that i didn't have time or my procrastinating self opted to sleep instead).

while 2009 has been a year of challenges, it was a very fulfilling year - i was jumping for joy and deliriously happy at the stroke of midnight last dec 31 my mind screaming, "i did it!". i survived my foray into independence! while for some it's very easy to just hop on a plane and work abroad, to me it was something i really felt like i HAD to do, but recognizably difficult for someone who is very dependent, emotional and submissive.

and sure enough, it was crazy reality - and very different from the comfortable cocoon i was used to being in. 

i've had my moments of lunacy and WTFs moments like leaving the office at 2am in the morning, sleepy, disoriented and tired but still able to walk home to my apartment (thank god for the low crime rate) , getting blasted through emails consistently (even being told that i need email / formatting lessons...yes, that degrading) or nearly missing my plane because i was doing overtime work (as always). but it was during those occasions when you realize just how blessed you are for being entrusted with these ordeals so that this experience would be as enriching as i hoped it would be.

moreover, He blessed me with a wonderful support group here and in manila, who were there for me whenever i wanted to give up completely. i feel awfully humbled by His wisdom, giving and surrounding me with these amazing people to love and share my life with as i go through this chosen path. each one of them patched up my bruised self-esteem and literally helped me get through each day.

my definition of love expanded to real, recognizable lessons on compromise, thoughtfulness, sacrifice, and optimism. it was very overwhelming, and i am still learning and embracing the lessons i get each day :)


i feel very, very blessed for this experience, very grateful, inlove with His infinite wisdom.
may He grant you your heart's deepest desires, and light up your life, as He did with mine.

happy 2010 everyone! 11 more months and we will all be another year wiser and happier :)

tagged me (a few months back...specifically last year hehe) nakakahiya. so here goes:


------------------------------


INSTRUCTIONS: Comment and I'll give you a letter; then you have to list ten things you LOVE that begin with that letter. Afterward, post this in your journal and give out some letters of your own.

------------------------------

B is for...

1) books - i love to read and i have been an avid reader since i was 6 years old. as a kid i have been known to finish the books bought for me in th car even before we got home. and wala pa masyadong traffic nun hehe.

2) bobhoover - 'nuff said :)

3) bige - one of my closest, fil-chi friend here in singapore.

4) blanket - i brought my two wool blankets here in singapore from manila. i have to sleep with it otherwise mahirap makatulog. that's why whenever i go home naninibago ako kasi andito sa singapore yung blankets ko :p

5) babies - i love babies, toddlers, kids! and my sister is pregnant and is making me a ninang this year yippeee!

6) bonuses - i am expecting one this year or else...lipat na haha.

7) beans - i loove pop beans (the greasy kind they sell in manila pero puwede na din yung hygienically packed here in sg).

8) bike - my mountain bike (i secretly christened her emily for the goth-like appearance). i miss riding it and i also miss riding with bobhoover in moa.

9) blueberry skinny muffin - my picker upper snack here in singapore. available in starbucks.

10) blair waldorf - haha not necessarily a "thing" but i love her seriously :D so much so that i am even following leighton meester on twitter hahahaha.


whew! tapos na din. mission accomplished :)

i haven't written anything here in a year. i have been lurking every 2 weeks to check on anything new and there were countless attempts to write something down but i never got around to putting down more than two sentences. so this is actually quite a feat. (3 sentences so far...keep going).

considering the changes that happened over the year (which are quite a lot i must say), i can only surmise that  my reason for not updating as often as i want to would be because i...
1) am still acclimatizing (should actually be a reason for me to update no?)
2) am too lazy to update
3) am too busy
4) have nothing to say

...in which case #4 would be a lie if anyone saw my twitter page. *toink*

okay so this coming-back-to-blogging post is obviously not making as much sense as i want it too. maybe i am just trying to make my comeback a little less stressful than the last few entries i posted (okay i browsed through my archives and ohmyeffingass lah..it was really filled with kinda embarassing emotional notes. looks like my early 2008 was full of high strung drama. bleh.) my only excuse for that is...i am but human (hahahahahah).  i guess emotions are such powerful, creative influencers.

nevertheless, i am quite happy to note that so far things are looking pretty rosy. though my work-life is far from perfect, i am quite thankful for so many things that have been instrumental in bringing a smile to my face every now and then...

1) a closer bond with my rents and my family (and i am getting a new pamangkin this year yahoo!)
2) my angels
3) ashby
4) pinoy sg mafia's quirks and drunken stupor (0 record for me this year so far hah!)
5) bobhoover :)

the year of the ox is bringing me good tidings. maybe it's the singapore air, im not really sure. though i cave in to loneliness and homesickness at times, the rational part of me still says that i am quite fortunate to be where i am now. thank you god for cheap calls to the philippines and singtel kababayan which have been instrumental in helping me keep my sanity.

ooppps i remembered that i still owe   an entry (i answered one of her entries which means i am considered tag -- well, i asked for it naman haha). will try to do that after i work on another slide of my report.

:)

God, grant me the serenity
to accept the things I cannot change...
the courage to change the things I can...
and the wisdom to know the difference.

in the next 165 hours , my career in rival T will be over. oh so happeeeeeee

im amazed at how the supreme being works. just a few months ago i was stressing about my utterly pathetic situation and then He grants me this reprieve.

i love how He monumentally assures me that He's there despite my hibernation from divinity. 

thank you, thank you!

i missed the outside world.

yet. nothing yet. hehehe. i'll enjoy this blissful moment at work which will probably translate to boredom in the next....hmmm...30 mins or so? hehehe.

it's my third day here at rival T and so far i think i'm doing pretty good. i've been on three presentations (egad!) for the categegories (uh-huh! categories!! and not just brands!!!) that i'll be handling. it's all good, i mean, i'd take food categories any day over telecoms (aka @*&#^@)_!!!), herbal products and financial services any day! hahahaha. i love my categories, i'll be handling chocolates and noodles mmmmmmmmmmmmmmm i can't wait for december when my clients give gift packs hahahaha. shet.

i've been taking advantage of my gym membership too the last couple of weeks. for the month of february, nasulit ko na yung monthly na binabayad ko hahahaha yay!!! my resolution and sheer fervor to lose the weight i've gained last year coincided with my skin allergy attacks (with causes still unknown). i've been to the allergologist last week and they've done blood tests to screen out any food i might be allergic to (in addition to pork). the doctor has given me a prescription and a 7 day diet to follow that will allow me to only eat food that will possibly not cause any allergic reaction and they are the following:

> rice, freshly baked bread
> peaches, pears, apples, banana, atis,melon, chico, grapes
> beef, lamb
> tilapia, bangus, dalagang bukid,
> fresh veggies only
> sugar, salt, pepper, white vinegar, honey (2 tbsp a day max only)
> water, buko juice, melon juice
> vegetable oil, olive oil, margarine, without coloring

so...everything that you don't see here, i can't eat / drink. that includes chicken, catsup, soy sauce, bbq sauce, mayonnaise, cheese, ham, tocino, milk, corned beef, seafood (shrimp, oysters, crabs, clams, tuna, etc), eggs and any product made with eggs, wheat bread, cakes, citrus fruits including oranges, mangoes,strawberries,etc. .......and the list goes on. it even prohibits me to wear / use/ apply make up and lotion.

i thought it was a piece of cake and since i was trying to lose weight anyway, i'd be better of following this na lang. so far.... i failed on my third day hehehe. ang hirap naman kasi eh! 

the true test of the level of difficulty emerged when im eating out. case in point:  i had dinner at next door / north park and after carefully making note of what i can't eat, ordered congee with sliced beef. i was feeling pretty pleased with myself until i saw that it also comes with clams and egg. so i asked the waitress to remove the egg and clams, explaining that im allergic to them. i felt bothered kasi feeling ko nalugi na ako kasi technically lugaw na lang yun with beef so i decided to order something else. i scanned the noodles list and excitedly ordered the beef noodles / mami. until i realized that i can't eat the noodles pala and that the soup (sabaw) is loaded with MSG. i opted to go back to the congee with a heavy heart. when my order came, it was disguised so well (you know the usual congee presentations, crunchy things on top with spring onions and leeks) that i felt my spirits rising when i looked at it. i was so hungry until i tasted it...walang lasa  eww hehehe!!! 

siyempre, sa mga nakakakilala sa akin, you know i put soy sauce or seasoning on my food whenever i can and that's exactly what i was thinking at that time while i reached for the soy sauce. kaya lang bawal din pala ang soy sauce so...i asked the same waitress to get me salt instead. i swear, i must've looked really pitiful while salting my congee. 

consuelo: masarap naman siya. kaya lang siguro dapat nag goodah na lang ako para mas mura.

i have difficulty rin trying to stay up because the medicines i have to take are like sleeping pills which i have to take during bedtime because they really make you sleepy. that's why it's so difficult to get out of bed every morning and i can't drink coffee rin kasi bawal. so puro water lang. oh well. at least sabi ng boss ko pumayat ako since the last time she saw me which was my interview last jan. uuy! :D

it's been an uneventful week. i'm happy though :D the challenges are blessings in disguise. tara, samahan niyo naman ako kumain sometimes! (once i find out officially what's causing my allergies then we can perhaps celebrate with buffet :D!)

advance TGIF you guys! :D

again i would like to apologize for not informing everyone that i went to vietnam, please believe me when i say that it really was a spur of the moment decision (soon as i found out  Moocher won't be going hehe...bad me). 

so finally here are some of my pictures. please bear with me, i know how much you want to see me but the lowly cameraman (woman for that matter) has to sacrifice a few glory pics so i can capture the essence of the place (sheesh. in other words, ako lang ang taga kuha period hehe). i befriended a japanese lolo who was also travelling alone on the ho chi minh city tour i went to and he was kind of enough to take my picture in the places i want to be seen in (of course this came about from an greement that i also take pictures of him in the places he wants to be seen in using his camera hehehehe...now that's give and take :D hahaha pang lolo lang ata ang beauty ko)

day 1: november 18 - i woke up late and barely made it to my flight. good thing that the centennial terminal is a lot less magulo than the naia terminal. upon landing, my parents met me and we went off to the guesthouse where my dad is billeted so we can drop off my luggage. the first thing i see on the way is...


yahoo! in your face mai.

here is my first meal in vietnam. we went to a mall that looks a lot like rustans and this is their version of foodcourt food.



how houses look like in vietnam. they have a specific number of meters allowed for the width of the house but the have no rule as to how many floors you can have so many of the houses here goes up to 5 floors hehe. 



that night we went to hear mass at a catholic church and it was nice to see a lot of pinoys there. being the bida as always, my parents introduced me to hundreds of faces that for the life of me i cannot remember anymore hehe. i went to dinner with my former boss, mother nelia and my former teammate abigail who was also visiting vietnam at that time.



day two: i went on a city tour around ho chi minh city. first stop was the giac lam temple



chinatown with my two new friends. on my right is mineo, the very nice japanese lolo i was telling you about earlier and on my left is nana, a singaporean teacher who is working in vietnam. everyone says we can pass off as one big happy family (nationality still yet to be resolved)



the tour was for one whole day but you have the option of not attending the afternoon tour. nana wasn't joining us on the afternoon tour so we had lunch together before she had to leave.


war museum: standing beside the a1- skyraider


diffused / dud bombs from the vietnam war


i like this one. we went to visit another temple where for 16,000 VND (viet nam dong) = $1 you can buy one of the swirly, spiraly things that you see in the ceiling. these are called wish incense and you can write your wishes / prayer intention on a paper, attach it to the incense and these will be lighted and hanged in the ceiling of the temple. they say that once the incense is finished off after 2-3 weeks, that's when your wish / prayer will be granted. if your wishes/prayer was granted you have the option of going back to the temple and offering a prayer for those who'se wishes /prayers are still unanswered.
 

notre dame church. patterned after the real notre dame church in france. the mother mary statue is the one said to have cried tears of blood but the vietnam government suppressed the news it being a communist country then.


post office. talo pinas hehe.


vietnamese girls = girls who do not have a weight problem despite eating tons of rice and rice noodles.


the end for now :D up next....

day 3-4: shopping spree with my rents
day 5: last-minute shopping hehe

just got back from vietnam!

short notice, sorry i couldnt inform everyone. i was crazily living and breathing work that i failed to ask for copies of bilins hehe...lucky sister! it's a good thing i labyu and i have good taste! nyahahahahahahaha. may bayad yung kipling bag! isa lang jan yung pasalubong ko!

i'll post pics soon. work got even with me by giving me 3 projects to launch before the end of november (gaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaag..$(*%&()#&*_)#&*&%^#}!!!). son of a gun people, i just got back! ease up a bit will ya?!

one thing's for sure, ho chi minh is definitely in a better situation than manila. owww, such a slap in the face. aside from the fact that it's cleaner, i hate to admit it but our english speaking capabilities (all the way down to the class E's and F's even) is nothing if you compare how much the vietnamese have improved over the years.

sob! (for the philippines)
hmmmmm....(seriously considering job opportunities in vietnam) hahahaha.

till my next post. ma-bu--hey!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

by the way, proof of my stress-filled life came in the form of hyperacidity bordering ulcer (i hied off to the doctor after i found myself writhing in pain on the floor 3 times while i was during midnight overtime and the day after). beware workaholics. i'm not allowed to drink cofee (sob!) and soda anymore. oh well. will it help me lose weight? hahahahaha. i can kick myself for being a sadist sometimes.

i haven't written a decent journal entry the past couple of...er..months. hehe so sorry about that. i feel like my life is such a blah that i don't really wanna document it that much. don't get me wrong, i get monumental highs every now and then but my lazy and procrastinating self just can't seem to make myself write things down. 

aside from work, one of the things that i've been doing on and off is airsoft. i started playing early this year and i so love the rush of being able to shoot someone lalo na when im really stressed. seeing the bbs shoot out of my mp5J is a natural high...coupled with the fact that i hit someone yahoo! ang sarap sarap :D oh, and did i mention that there are A LOT of guys (single and the nagpapanggap na single) kaya to those who wanna try out a new sport (and meet new...shall we say "friends") would probly wanna join me slug these hommes in their army cammo duds. 


me and my baby mp5J sandwiched between sir abner in the urban cammo and hans in the us woodlan acupat


some of the dudes that i play with. don't worry they won't bite. but they sure could use a bath after playing. (u get to meet guys like these willing to have their pictures taken)


me resting during a night game (see the smug smile? i hit someone that night eh wheee!)


me heading back to base after getting hit


i know, i look like a cross between a midget terrorist or a civillian wearing a gas mask.


without my army duds on (see i still look like a girl) even if i am carrying a glock


the g.i janes that i play with (of course we don't look this way when we're playing. its a shame to hurt those beautiful skin)

it's nice to take up something different every once in awhile. you get to meet all sorts of characters in this game and if you think girls go way overboard when it comes to dressing up, then you're in for a treat here. i've never seen so many army fanatics in one place. they all looked like army recruits with their spanking guns and head to toe gear. duringmy first game, one guy even had army paint on his face and leaves taped on his boonie cap that i honestly thought he was a walking bush. 

anyone care to join me? kampay! :D

Leave your name and... 
1. I'll respond with something random about you. 
2. I'll challenge you to try something. 
3. I'll pick a color that I associate with you. 
4. I'll tell you something I like about you. 
5. I'll tell you my first/clearest memory of you. 
6. I'll tell you what animal you remind me of. 
7. I'll ask you something I've always wanted to ask you. 
8. If I do this for you, you must in turn post this meme on your LJ. 
9. With a letter I assign to you, you must write ten things that you like that begin with that letter. 

acid_t3st  gave me the letter "o"

Oranges
Ocean
Oysters (baked lang...yummm i miss una mas)
Obligations
Olives (sliced...in puttanesca sauce only hehe)
Odyssey (Illiad hehe)
Oils (thereapeutic ones)
Oil paintings
Opalesce (i love this word)
Orchids

i hate it when people whom you consider friends betray you just because "client" na sila. wtf?!? who gave you the right to hound me with your requests, lying to me straight-faced that my boss knew about it already so i don't have any reason not to give you all the data you needed? you should know better. you've been in this scenario many times and you know what would happen when we put our ass on the line. you also know the code of ethics that we practice which is a must in the industry we're in. i'm disappointed in you.

i used to look up to you, you know?

sige laro tayo kung yan gusto mo.

This is how it works: Comment on this entry and I will give you a letter. Write ten words beginning with that letter in your journal, including an explanation what the word means to you and why, and than pass out letters to those who want to play along. 

acid_t3st gave me the letter "F"

1) fatima - part of my full name. i used to dread the month of october when I was in grade school coz that was the marian or rosary month. i'd cringe everytime they sing "Our Lady of Fatima" for my classmates would look at me and giggle for being named after someone holy and time and again, i'd mentally curse my parents for being so old-fashioned and not giving me a normal (or i guess, a western sounding name hehe...ayan ang impluwensiya ng sweet valley!!). nevertheless, i grew up kind of embarassed about my real name until i met my namesake about 4 years ago when her statue was being toured around the world. i looked at her face and for once felt like i met a kindred spirit who understood my angst though i dont know why. i felt ashamed but promised to make her proud since then :)

2) frogs - pakitaan niyo na ako ng lahat wag lang ito. kahit nasa tv or magazine pa yan, kadiri pa rin yan. lalo na siempre kung actual... ay magkakamatayan talaga tayo.

3) flowers - i love flowers!! buti na lang masipag ako bigyan ng bulaklak ng mga tao...hihihi. i sometimes buy flowers on a whim for my cube. di naman bouquet ha, mga tig-isang stem lang hehe.

4) french - a language i used to study religously pero i had to stop when i had to miss classes because of work.( waaaaaaah). i missed the enrollment last feb and promise ko sa sarili ko to enroll again in august.

5) food trip - one of the things i love doing. trying out new restos is something i try to do every month :)

6) fort oval - i miss this place. used to let my dog run around here and i also jog here sometimes. *!^#(*&@*& na ayala yan...giniba na yung fort oval so they can put up a condo (sob!)

7) fintess first fort (o diba alliteration pa hehehe) - my gym....one year ago hehe. gone were the days when i would saintly time out of work by 6pm to make it to my 7pm dance class or spinning class. gone also is the firm phsyique i earned from those intense workouts.

8) fairfield inn suites - i stayed in this hotel when i went to chicago. i love mariott hotels!!!

9) foot spa - one of the reasons why i love living in the philippines...daming klase ng foot spa with prices ranging from those catering to the penny-pinching yuppies to the son-of-a-gun-are-you-kidding me-?!?! rates. foot spas are one if the indulgences i give in to pag asar sa office.

10) figaro c.palanca st. - one of those hidden coffeeshops i used to escape to when im on the brink of sanity.

just when i think that everything seems to be going well i trip on something like that of a reality landmine and everything blows up in my face. i envy my brother who's leaving for the u.s this month. i wish i could escape reality just like him. 

hell i wish i could just get away.

one word.

ouch.

yun lang huhu. ayoko na talaga dito. damn.

after weeks of overtime (yep...hindi lang days...weeks!!!!) trying to familiarize myself with the new responsibilities that came my way, i reached a definite conclusion:

GUSTO KO NA MAGPAKA-HOUSEWIFE!

my teammate and i were walking back to the office after a team lunch out and we were talking about how much we wanted to just take care of kids the rest of our lives coz we were so tired of what we were doing (she's been with the company for 5 months pa lang and yet she feels this way already!). initially, being a housewife wasnt something id want for myself a few years back...i was happy with what im doing. the endless thirst for knowledge in the field im in was always there, it was fun to be updated with products i eat, i use while bathing, i take to relieve myself of any physical ailment. i felt like i had the upperhand and an insider scoop on how a certain product or an ad came to be and i could rationalize why certain products appealed to different age groups. in short, i felt like i knew A LOT and that was something i was afraid of losing.

but now i feel like putting a sign in my cube that says INFORMATION OVERLOAD! things to do just keep coming in, clients would call for answers im still trying to understand myself and keeping them happy is taking its toll on what i used to see as a reason for staying. plus, we dont get OT pay huhu. dammit. 

late last year, 3 of my officemates have turned in their resignation, two of them stating "workload overload" as their primary reason for leaving (the other one had "irreconcilable differences" with her immediate boss as a reason...hanep parang showbiz couple but that's a different story hehe) but nevertheless i guess the feeling of having too much work is not an isolated case here. so now that i've tasted how corporate life is, i think i can honestly say that this isn't something i would subject myself to for the most part of my life. i wouldnt even want to subject my future family to this, i don't think i can stomach the fact that i have to go home to a sleeping family who tried to wait up for me. that's just sad. 

o sige back to work na...im on ot again today. sh*t! if only walang bills to pay.

im baaaack!!

and im siiiiick (still). hehe.

what people said when they saw me:

1) pumayata ka! nagpunta ka ba ng states?! (uuy ayos! south beach works! hehehe kidding :D)
2) tumaba ka! mukhang sarap vacation ah! (ano ba talaga?!)
3) pumuti ka! (now this is wierd, maaraw din naman dun kahit may snow ah)
4) nag-uwi ka pa ng sakit dito! dibale imported naman (ayos pinoy talaga hehehe)
5) kulang chocolates mo! (aba, aba, aba!)
6) umuwi ka na, we'll postpone the meeting tomorrow, pahinga ka na (from my boss. awwww)

may deadline nga pala ako today. hehehe. sige na nga ill be a saint and not go on undertime.

I love Maryland! Never mind that I'm sick for three days now, nothing can stop me from going out and seeing the sights (*ubo*ubo*shopping*ubo*). partner in crime   has been so kind to me, driving me wherever i want to go and showing me around. i've been here for a week already and i feel like i dont want to go home anymore huhuhu. (that's what i get for checking office mail while i'm on vacation. darn it). i hate reading mails that say i've deadlines on jan. 10...my god that's like my first day back in the office and i've deadlines already. obviously i need to work my lazy ass off as soon as i step back to reality and the thought of it makes me want to extend my stay here even more hehehe. ang tamad ko.

------------------------

dec. 21 - departed bloomington, illinois for baltimore (supposedly at 6am but because of heavy fog we were delayed by 4 hours waaaah!) so i missed all my connecting flights for baltimore in atlanta and if that wasn't worse enough, when i finally landed in baltimore my suitcase was nowhere to be seen. my balat ata ako hehe. it was nice seeing my niece and nephews though, i forgot i was supposed to be pissed off.

dec. 22 - woke up early to go to new york and new jersey to visit my uncle and meet up with cousins. (oh yeah, naiwan ako ng bus sa terminal so i had to take another bus going to new york (may balat talaga ako hehehe) i was actually dreading the bus ride but it wasnt so bad, i felt so independent going there on my own (i've to check my wallet every now and then though in fear of being mugged..that's what i see on tv eh hahaha) just kidding but my uncle was really nice enough to show me around and let me experience how commuting in new york was like. new jersey andaming filipino and we even had our meals in filipino restos and bakeries hehehe. my uncle made my trip worth it by giving me cool gifts the next day before i left for baltimore, a digicam and an ipod nano :D

dec. 24 - stayed at the home and helped ate sally prepare the santa gifts for the kids. uploaded mp3s sa nano and let kuya use it first hehe.

dec. 25 - ate sally, kuya raymund and katrina gave me a great christmas gift....a les miserables ticket! the show was for that day and after my initial tour with ate sally, katrina and i went to the national theatre in washington dc to watch it. the actor who portrayed jean valjean was soo good i think im inlove with him already despite the fact that he's about sean connery's age hehehe. after the show, katrina and i milled outside the theatre acting like regular turistas by taking each other's pictures beside the poster (huhu last showing na daw ito ng les mis..buti nakanood pako before they ceased production of the show completely) and trying to wait for the cast members to come out to uh..get their autograph and make pa-picture (di naman ako taga rito eh bakit ba hehe) :D

dec. 26 - went to kuya marco's (ate sally and katrina's brother) house in baltimore for their annual christmas party. i barely knew most of the people there but they were all so nice and welcoming i felt like a part of their side officially hehehe. they even have gifts for me! wow sarap hehehe. kuya marco has this neat studio and we basically jammed the whole afternoon. had karaoke contest too, and wow the food! i took a picture of the fondue before we attacked so my pics will have to follow hehehe.

dec. 27 - katrina suggested movie marathon so off we went to muvicom, this cineplex in arundel where they have 12 theatres. movies here cost a lot, $7!! but katrina taught me how to get my money's worth. i wont mention the details here but the bottomline is we were able to watch 3 movies for the price of one. and oh, ganda ng narnia!!!

dec. 28 - got karma from watching 3 movies that i was burning up with fever and my allergies attacked that morning. cathy hovered over me asking me to get well so we can push through with our planned trip to the baltimore national aquarium. after lunch i was well enough to leave, heavily layered with clothes hehehe. we watched the dolphin show which lasted 16 freakin mins only. okay lang buti na lang cute sila.

dec. 29 - road trip to rehoboth beach in delaware to shop at outlet malls na walang tax. not even thundershowers can prevent us from enjoying our trip. pure heaven pag walang tax! ayan nawalan na tuloy ako ng money hehehe.

dec. 30 - home sick. hahahahaha. okay lang, we'll be going around parin later coz i wanna buy rollerblades! katrina will take me to a store where she bought hers on sale, originally costs more than $100 but she was able to get it for $7 only!!!

bottomline, ang tigas ng ulo ko :D even with me coughing and blowing my nose every now and then coupled with pill popping at odd hours, im having a blast here! ayoko na umuwi hahahaha. the thought of going back to work makes me want to crawl under the blankets and sleep nanaman under the influence of benadryl anti-histamine. i've been taking that for my allergies and it did wonders for my sleeping habits (pampaantok din kasi hehe). i never got around to telling you guys that despite my 2 wk stay here, ive been unable to get used to the sleeping hours. i'd wake up early in the morning around 2am and then going back to sleep. nakakdiretso lang ako ng sleep when i take my allergy medication hehehe. di ko na nga pipilitin sarili ko by adjusting eh, malapit nanaman ako umuwi.

--------------------------------------------

it's dec. 31 na pala diyan sa manila. happy new year everyone!:D

freakin' cold. white christmas...mmmmmm :D

ive been wanting to update my journal soon as i got here but there is just so many things to see around here (i can almost hear   laughing at what i just wrote).  soon as i got here, they've been hounding him on his sightseeing plans for me and when he mentioned touring this city as a given, they all said "that'll only take an hour. what else have you got planned?". hehe well...the town sure is a sleepy one. but i really like it, compared to chicago, i prefer the suburbs to the bustling city life (check on me after a few days and lets see if this thought changed hahaha). but yeah, contrary to what he thinks (and what most of his friends think as well) i think bloomington is just perfect. sure, the nightlife here could use some help (the bar closes at 1am) and the only shop open for 24 hours (aside from the gasoline station) is krispy kreme but still, its very nice. people here are very friendly, and its nice to walk around seeing little children and infants bundled up in thick coats with just their eyes showing (think mini-michellin man). i've met most of  's friends and they're very nice. btw, ive taken note of the single men here and for anyone of you interested daming good catch haha :D pictures to follow. id have to take a picture of them without my guardian watching hehehe.

 i was holed up this morning with a hangover. my gosh the people here sure make up for the lack of gimmick places by downing drinks that would put kanto boys to shame. gimmick place happened to be the apartment of a friend who just left this morning and as an initiation, they made me drink a shot of tequila. its not pretty bad but it's been awhile since i last drank and my stomach's not used to drinking anymore so my tummy acted up. so as not to make them persuade me to drink another shot, i compromised by drinking margarita the entire night instead. sarap their margarita! i should've taken a hint that i was drunk already when i went out with my guardian to get the foil for the hookah from his apartment and i didnt feel the need to put my jacket on. and it was -2 degrees last night. egad.

so here i am with a splitting headache, thank god for angels,   made me lunch, baked chicken and vegetables yummmy :) i could get used to this hehehe sans the headache of course.

just 8 more days to go and i'll be goooooone!!! i can't wait to get out of this cube...working just doesnt seem that fun anymore when you're faced with people you really don't wanna see..

bye bye workplace...definitely wont be sorry about the fact that ill be going on vacation earilier than expected. i'm about to lose my mind with all the intrigues i've been hearing. wala na nga ako sa makati madalas i still get them. oh well..i wont let that bother me, maybe next year things will be better. harhar. i still have that masquerade party on friday to take care of...i really don't want to go but sige na nga. i have a distinct feeling that this will be my last christmas party with this company anyway, so what the heck, magpapaganda nako :D 

anyone who can tell me where i can get a masquerade mask (white and gold motif...i'll be coming in as a fairy/princess/angel/ewan...ah basta white and gold! limited costume options eh hahahaha) i'll appreciate it if you can tell me.

i'm still here in our ortigas office waiting for practice to start (would you look at that? not only am i attending the stupid party, im actually even part of the program) guess it's a small price to pay since they allowed me to go on leave for a month...o sige hindi naman one month, mga 25 days lang :D so what the heck, bring it on! just don't let me dance the salsa with our ceo. my graciousness has its limits.

--------------------------------------------------------------

what i'll miss this december/january (christmas and new year):

1) simbang gabi - nothing like the feeling of waking up to attend dawn mass...while also trying not to doze off during the homily. i keep myself awake by counting the number of people dozing off and how many of them kilala ko hehehe. then again, my sister can attest to the fact that i dont attend simbang gabi as religiously as she does but still, i'll miss the feeling of attending at least..uh...3 of 'em. i usually go on the first and second day and on my birthday. if i have enough reason and willpower (read: my dad bribes me with puto bumbong or bibingka or when i was a freakin' teenager kasi andun kasi crush ko) then i go on another day hehehe. walang ganyan sa states!

2) "meri krismas po!" - coupled with "bumalik na lang kayo sa pasko!" wow what a scrooge. where's the christmas spirit in that? oh wait...that's me nga pala shouting from our house to the kids who rattle on our gates after halfheartedly singing "sa may bahay" as early as the last week of november. hehehe...oops.

3) villagemates - those i dont usually see (this will include my neighbor whom i haven't seen in hmm...10 months? not bad for someone who live a house away from me). childhood friends usually reappear on christmas eve during the christmas eve mass. awww. ill miss the reunion this year. regalo ko ha. pakibigay na lang kay mia (teehee)

4) neighbor na may sinturon ni hudas - enough said. god forbid they make enough noise for all the houses in our street combined.

oops gotta go to practice na (wow i never fail to amaze myself..what...dedication!) hahahaha  <------- sucker.

to be continued :D

its sunday and im still here in the office...its 6:30pm.

such a loser.

its called "throwing-yourself-at-work-to-escape-harsh-realities"... which may have been caused by parent drama, currently happening at home. hmm. home is not "sweet home" as of the moment.

buti na lang andito si manong guard..nakakatakot pala mag-stay dito ng sunday pag gabi. at least may kasama ako...maya nako uwi.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

i went to mass awhile ago. left the office at 2:30pm hoping to get a good seat inside the well-ventilated greenbelt church for the 3pm mass (honest, malamig sa loob if you guys wanna check it out). but alas, every mallrat seemed to have the same thing in mind. i had to resort to standing inside one of the bridges connecting the greenbelt island church dome to the park and by the time homily started, i was sweating like crazy and my legs were being peppered by mosquitos. glancing inside the church i saw a lady get out of the confessional box and no one else followed suit. hmm..ive been wanting to go to confession for quite sometime kasi matagal na ko di nakaka communion so i ambled over to the confessional box. i wasn't really planning on going inside but when i was there na, what the heck i went in na lang (baka malamig sa loob eh) while the choir started playing the offertory song.

the a/c felt sooo good because it was sweltering hot outside. i welcomed the full blast of chilly air and sank gratefully to my knees and prepared my rehearsed speech and mental list of "sins" (you know the usual stuff and generic childlike sins that you do not have any plans of elaborating to the priest). needless to say, i got more than what i bargained for. would not go into the itty-bitty details of what i said (you guys wish hehehe) but i found myself saying and confessing a lot and having philosophical discussions with the priest who was kind and patient enough to answer every query and debate challenge i threw at him. when i went out of that confessional box, i was in tears but i was happy, i felt drained but light-hearted. i listened to the last strains of the communion song that the choir was singing (yep, i was in that booth for quite some time) and for the first time that day i smiled.

few things i've learned:
-god does not put you in a bad situation. you do.
-everyone has a second chance. all you have to do is ask for it...through prayer.
-a sin, no matter how small it is is still a sin.
-everyone has freewill which gives them an argument to say that they can live their life the way they want to..."pikit ka muna god ha" and its true. just don't go running back to god when things get messed up because he has no hand in that. you did. again, freewill, remember?

i could go on and on but those are the few thigns that i was mulling about while heading back to the office. ang hirap naman mamuhay ng masaya pero tama... being "tao lang" is not an excuse.

well after today, this workaholic will certainly try.

Your Birthdate: December 19
Your birth on the 19th day of the month adds a tone of independence and extra energy to your life path. But at the same time, it poses a number of obstacles to overcome before you are able to be as independent as you would like. The number 1 energy suggests more executive ability and leadership qualities than your path may have indicated. A birthday on the 19th of any month gives greater will power and self-confidence, and very often a rather original approach. However, a somewhat self-centered approach to life that may be in conflict with some of the other influences in your life. This 1 energy may diminish your ability and desire to handle details, preferring instead to paint with a broad brush. You are sensitive, but your feeling stay somewhat repressed. You have a compelling manner that can be dominating in many situations. You do not tend to follow convention or take advice very well. Consequently, you tend to learn through experience; sometimes hard experiences. The 19/1 is a loner number and you may experience feelings of being alone even if you are married. You may take on a tendency to be nervous and angry.
What Does Your Birth Date Mean?

tonight and the rest of my liiiife

- Nina Gordon "Tonight And The Rest Of My Life"

-------------------------------------------------------

woke up with a heady feeling, arms feeling like lead, head throbbing, eyes swelling. i thought "this is worse than a drunken hangover". of course it didn't help that i slept at 2am and then woke up at 630am to go to work. hehehe. welcome to the after-effects of a hookah session :)

of course i've only myself to blame. i was the one who insisted on rebelling that night. my friends   and   originally planned on having dinner only at rufus (where i watched encantadia for the first time hehehe) and when we passed by ziggurat on our way to kalayaan, i felt a "hookah-force" so forceful (?!?!) that i knew i had to try it. --> side note: how redundant can i get?? haha.

ok back to the story (obviously the grape/apple-flavored hookah still had smoke remnants embedded in my brain). so we passed by ziggurat on our way to rufus and i cajoled them into having a hookah session after having dinner. and so we did...(to  and   , di naman super obvious na i really wanted to go through with it nung tanong ako ng tanong if u guys want to nung nasa rufus pa tayo diba? hehehe).  so there we were in ziggurat..naka-indian sit sa carpet (mayfield had to sit with her legs neatly tucked underneath her, side by side because she was wearing a skirt =D ...ooohlala!) and after ordering drinks and deciding on grape-flavored tobacco, the chemist demonstrated the proper way of using the shishah / hookah. it was so much fun! i initially choked on most of the grape-flavored smoke i attempted to blow through my mouth but eventually learned how to blow the smoke "smoothly" out of my mouth. seems like i have the talent for it hehehe.

it felt exhilarating. there was this one point wherein i felt so giddy by my failed attempts to look like a smoker that i couldn't stop laughing and crying at the same time. my companions were looking at me as if i had lost my mind and i couldn't care less coz i was having so much fun laughing at my pathetic efforts not to choke (and feeling lightheaded already at the same time =D). i'd probably get their own reaction about my behavior last night after posting this hehehe.

do not worry, rest assured that the smoke i inhaled last night is not the nakaka-high type --- despite the fact that it may seem like it is based on the randomness of this post ;)

going back, obviously, we got hooked on the shishah (no pun intended hehe). we ordered another round of hookah, this time, apple flavor naman. we took turns taking pictures of one another inhaling through the pipe and we were laughing crazily amongst ourselves by our failed attempts to capture the smoke blowing from our mouths in most of the pictures. oh well..di naman aalis ang ziggurat eh, try ulit natin next time hahahaha =D

we left ziggurat at around 1am. (so much for my promise to my dad to go home by 1230 hehehe). with mayfield driving, (with her driving putting cab drivers to shame) i was home in no time. gave my dad a huge grin when he opened the door with a scowl on his face and said "sino naghatid sayo at bakit ang ingay ng kotse niya parang pang-karera?! bakit lalaki?" i could only laugh at him and explain how "my driver" can hardly be considered a drag-racer...much less,a guy hehehe.

don't worry mayfield, my dad's bark is worse than his bite. he's harmless :)

-----------------------------------------------------------

, enjoy your euro trip!! :)

(*tear*) hehehe, kidding aside, another great thing about this is that i actually have "prospective tennants" asking about it already. hopefully everything goes well =D

i can still remember my last post, which was way back in january (hehehe). forgive my absence, i've only my work to blame. ahh the joys of management conferences, it gives us lowly execs the chance to kick back and relax (aka watch dvds in the conference room, play the sims all day, hang out in greenbelt during work hours, extend..erm..over extend lunch breaks and nap all day in our desks) while the higher beings pretend to participate in their conference in shanghai, at the same time, secretly comparing bargain prices and shopping places in china (market research is dominated by women).

but we're not that bad. really.

i'll enjoy this reprieve while it lasts. oh, and did i mention that im on leave tomorrow?

hehehe..such a good mood =D

so..i've been to what, 3 despedidas within the last 2 months? first my manager joyce moves to singapore, secondly tita meding, the former field supervisor leaves to try her hand in the family business, then ning, our retail director resigns to become a full-fledged housewife...just as she's been promising her husband for 4 years now.

i guess its inevitable that these things happen, i mean last year's re-org brought about by the resignation of our two..uh.. #@*#*$!%$!! heads almost threw us off track..nearly causing us to forego our projects because we were all dazed by what happened..and what was about to happen. The higher ups frantically changes the organizational structure and gave us neverending pep talks to boost our morale. It did little to help us, we were all walking around like zombies as colleagues handed in their resignation. fortunately for me and my team, we were one of the blessed ones who were able to retain their groups when the re-org was announced. i couldn't have thanked god profusely for this.

i used to question the feelings of these people who (and are about to) resign. i would wonder what gave them that push to just make up their minds and leave...of course reasons are something that u cant really argue with. i could never really understand these thoughts until i started having them this week. i dont know if my mom's fervent prayer for me to live her lifelong dream is suddenly working but i'm seriously considering about leaving and pursuing other er..fields. and its scares me..because i just started thinking about them and as weird as it may sounds, suddenly its as if something is really pushing me into that direction. an opening comes up, with qualifications that uncannily resembles my background, so on and so forth. it reminded me of that line in paulo coelho's "the alchemist" that goes soemthing like, "when you want something, the whole universe conspires for you to get it". hehehe hope got that right.

all in all, as my officemates and i schedule yet another despedida for another colleague who is leaving next month, i cant help but wonder when mine will ever be. hehehe anyway its just a thought ;p im leaving everything to god so he can give me a nudge in the right direction.

just wanted to share something forwarded by a good friend
-----------------------------------------------------------

from peyups.comm
 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
 
During what women believe to be the start of a budding romance, certainty about where the relationship is going is never questioned. To us, "it's in the bag" without necessarily saying this out loud. "He calls, he tells me he misses me, asks me out often, is relentlessly sweet and thoughtful. I am always on cloud nine and apologetically unable to wipe the grin off my face. I am in love with him and although he hasn't said so yet, I am sure he loves me too." 
Herein lies the tragedy. 

Until a man asks you to be his girlfriend, you are not on safe ground. No matter how few the minutes are between his text messages or his phone calls, even if he has tried to hold your hand, carefully pick off the eyelash from under your eye, and wipe the crumb perched on your upper lip, assume that he just wants to be friends. Assume otherwise and you'll be in for great big heartbreak. 

Men are almost formulaic - especially those who have remained single after 25. When faced with the same given in the same situation, no matter where they come from, they will all do the same thing. Enter the questions women love to ask: 1. Why hasn't he called me in the past few days; 2. If he likes being with so much, why doesn't he leave his girlfriend/wife for me? As much as we would like to fall back into thinking men are idiots and need a little shove off into the right direction, it's better to keep your hands where they are. Do not text, call or make a bigger fool of yourself. There's just one answer to all the questions: He doesn't love you enough. 

Let's take each situation one at a time. He hasn't called you in the past few days. Women will immediately assume that there's something wrong. His cellphone is off, he is sick, he got into an accident, he's upset with me, etc. We say to ourselves, "It's okay for me to text him, at least he'll think that I care about him and that I'm thoughtful. Plus once lang naman to eh. After this I'll never initiate texting. 

More brazen women could come right out at the guy and ask, "Why haven't you called me?" Whenever my women friends tell me they did this, I visibly cringe and have to stop myself from hitting them on the head. You see, a man's initial feelings for a woman are not usually carved in stone. 

How he feels about you is very much like writing on the sand. You have to be careful so that he won't change his mind about you. My guy friends who confide in me (voluntarily) have the same facial statement when they tell me about the girl who asked them the question, "Why haven't you called me?" They look like they have the heebie-jeebies. They freak out and start complaining about this. They haven't called you because they don't feel like it. They might feel like it later but at the moment they don't so they won't. They are aware that you exist and don't need you to remind them about it. Do you want that? I don't think so. They also tell me that men are entitled to change their mind the way women do. They are also flaky and "not sure" all the time. 

Sometimes men are looking for icing on the cake in the form of a woman friend who plugs in all the gaps that his better half cannot fill. She is usually somebody with slightly different qualities than his mate. He enjoys being with her, calls her all the time, consults with her about life-altering decisions but does not really come out and make a decision about who he wants to be with simply because he is in a "safe place." He has the best of both worlds and doesn't need to make a choice. If he hasn't left his girlfriend for you yet, chances are, he won't. 

Telltale signs: She is still his priority. When she calls and asks him to pick her up, he hurriedly finishes his meal and tells you he has to go. When you ask him out on days when he has to take her home, he'll say he can't. You notice that you are only together when his schedule permits it and when seeing you does not conflict with his time with his girlfriend. You get the crumbs. This kind of arrangement only tells you that he doesn't love you enough for him to forsake his girlfriend for you. If he takes a chance by leaving her for you, you're sure that he loves you. Most men would stay with the safe, the tried and tested over risking everything. 

Obviously, you don't want to be second best. Find someone who will make you his only priority. Although they pretend and seem otherwise, men are not idiots when it comes to matters of the heart. They know fully well what they want out of the relationship. They do not need to be rescued by you. They don't need hints, carefully crafted text messages or highway billboards that promise them a bed of roses with you. If he really likes you, he will do anything to get you to like him back. You just have to sit there and wait for your nails to dry. Trust me. I can get enough signatures from the creeps to validate this.

-------------------------------------------------------------

okay so my first post isn't exactly short hehehe.. =P

i dont exactly know how to react to this article. i guess its safe to say that i do agree with one thing...do not assume anything. the living premise on this one basically connotes or reinforces a girl's mantra which she desperately wants to follow...but just can't seem to because of that darn, persistent guy (who seem to just have that uncanny ability of getting under our skin by striking where we are most vulnerable). okay, so it doesn't help at all that he just has to be really, really cute... (hehehe)

it helps to have friends who pinches you once in awhile to bring you back to reality. (thanks guys) although at the end of the day.. it's really all up to you to decide on what to do. afterwards, it's a great comfort to bitch about these experiences over ice monster concoctions with your angels (hehehe =P)
